Key Arguments: The definitions of 'misinformation' and 'disinformation' in the proposed Bill are vague, subjective, and open to manipulation and abuse.
The Bill is seen as patronizing at best and tyrannical at worst.
Freedom of speech is a fundamental value that should be protected.
The appropriate response to misinformation is to allow more information and encourage debate.
Restricting information should be limited to cases involving violence and terrorism, not matters of opinion.
Main Themes: Encouragement of Debate and Information Sharing
Notable Quotes: At best, such a Bill is patronising, at worst it is tyrannical.
It is the right and freedom of each citizen to make their own judgment about what is true or false or misleading.
We strongly urge all Members of Parliament to vote against this proposed Bill.
